metadata.title: CVE-2020-12464 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
usb_sg_cancel in drivers/usb/core/message.c in the Linux kernel before5.6.8 has a use-after-free because a transfer occurs without a reference,aka CID-056ad39ee925.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12464` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1015-kvm - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1015-aws - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1016-azure - 5.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1015-gcp - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1015-oracle - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1010-oem - 5.6.0-1010.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1012-raspi - 5.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1015.15').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1015.15').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1016.16').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1015.15').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1015.15').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needs-triage').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1010.10').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1012.12').
